addCssClass.desc: The name of the class you want to add to the canvas
addCssClass.title: Add CSS Class

addFilePath.desc: The filepath of the canvas you want to add a class to

commands.addCanvas: Add a CSS Class to the active canvas
commands.quickSwitch: Quick switch between workspace-leaf-content & body mode
commands.removeCanvas: Remove a CSS Class from the active canvas

error.alreadyApplied: This class is already applied to this canvas.

renameCssClass.desc: The name of the class you want to rename
renameCssClass.title: Rename CSS Class

renameFilePath.desc: The new filepath of the canvas you want to rename
renameFilePath.title: Edit canvas filepath

addButton.name: Add button in the page header
addButton.quickSwitch: Button: Quick switch between view modes

settings.alreadyApplied: This class is already applied to this canvas.

appendMode.bodyDesc: Append the canvas to the body. Allow to export as an image with the canvas but can have some unexpected mode, notably when multiple files are open.

default.desc: The default mode to append the class to the canvas, including canvas-file and the data-canvas-path attribute, when the canvas is opened or created.
default.title: Default appending mode

appendMode.desc: Where to append the class into the canvas.
appendMode.title: Append Mode
appendMode.workspaceLeafDesc: Append the canvas to the workspace-leaf-content. Keep the class when focus change but can't be exported with the image.

console.desc: Allows to better follow the additions/removals made by the plugin. Notice will display an Obsidian notification.
console.title: Log Level

newClass.addingInfo: Add a class to this canvas

settings.useCommandsInfo: Use the commands modal to add a canvas and a class.
